properties.areaDesc: Mono; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 9 at 12:37PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
Strong gusty northeast winds between 30 and 40 mph are creating
areas of blowing dust across Western Nevada and even into parts of
northeast California this afternoon.

As of 1230 PM the thickest dust was impacting Highway 395 between
Doyle and Susanville, Highway 95 between Fallon and Lovelock, and
Highway 50 between Fallon, Fernley, and Silver Springs.
Visibilities in these areas could drop to a few hundred feet.
Other areas of dust were affecting Reno and Carson City but not as
dense with visibilities between one and three miles.

Be prepared for blowing dust and rapid changes in visibility when
traveling around the region today. Strong gusty cross winds will
also make driving challenging especially for high profile
vehicles. Winds and dust concentrations are forecast to drop off
this evening.
